title: Italian Pasta Salad Recipe
description: This Italian pasta salad with salami, mozzarella, bell pepper, and rotini pasta tossed in zesty Italian dressing is sure to be a summer favorite.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Salad Pasta Salad Italian Pasta Salad Recipes Italian Pasta Salad 4.8 (170) 136 Reviews 46 Photos This Italian pasta salad that's loaded with tri-color rotini pasta, salami, bell peppers, and fresh mozzarella balls is quick to make and full of flavor for a delicious summertime salad. By Trish Updated on April 9, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 46 46 46 46 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 12 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe This delicious Italian pasta salad comes together quickly with salami, fresh mozzarella, colorful bell pepper, and red onion, all tossed in Italian salad dressing.  How to Make Italian Pasta Salad You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe below, but let's go over the basics: Italian Pasta Salad Ingredients These are the ingredients you’ll need to make this quick and easy Italian pasta salad recipe:  Pasta: This colorful Italian pasta salad recipe starts with tri-color rotini pasta.Salami: Finely diced Italian salami lends meaty, salty flavor. Vegetables: You’ll need green and red bell peppers, a red onion, and canned black olives.Cheese: Small fresh mozzarella balls add creaminess and rich bursts of flavor. Shredded Parmesan cheese, meanwhile, is the perfect finishing touch. Dressing: You’ll need a cup of Italian-style dressing and three packages of dry Italian-style salad dressing mix. How to Make Pasta Salad With Italian Dressing Here’s a brief overview of what you can expect when you make this Italian pasta salad at home:  Boil the pasta until tender-yet-firm.Combine the pasta, salami, veggies, and mozzarella in a bowl.Toss in salad dressing, then stir in the dressing mix. Sprinkle with Parmesan before serving.  Can You Make Italian Pasta Salad Ahead of Time?  This Italian pasta salad is a great make-ahead potluck dish. In fact, since the flavors will continue to meld as they sit together in the fridge, this dish might actually taste better if you make it a day in advance.  How to Store Italian Pasta Salad Store your leftover Italian pasta salad in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to five days.  Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise “The best recipe ever,” raves The happy traveller. “My husband was licking the empty bowl. I added cherry tomatoes and will go lighter on the red onion next time.” “Delicious,” according to one Allrecipes community member. “Looking for a recipe for a summer family reunion, with no mayo. This was perfect! Even looks nice.” “Yummy and easy,” says another community member. “I don't worry about the color of the peppers — I use whatever I have on hand. Hubby isn't a fan of raw onions, so I add chopped chives instead which are much milder, but still give a hint of onion taste.” Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 1 (12 ounce) package tri-color rotini pasta ¾ pound Italian salami, finely diced ½ green bell pepper, sliced ½ red bell pepper, sliced ½ red onion, chopped 1 (6 ounce) can sliced black olives 8 ounces small fresh mozzarella balls 1 cup Italian-style salad dressing 3 (.7 ounce) packages dry Italian-style salad dressing mix, or to taste ½ cup shredded Parmesan cheese Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook rotini pasta at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water until cool. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Combine pasta, salami, bell peppers, onion, mozzarella balls, and olives in a large bowl. Add salad dressing and toss to coat. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Season pasta salad with dry salad dressing mix and stir to combine. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese before serving. Enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 469 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Italian Pasta Salad 01 of 46 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 46 Photo by  Cassie 04/22/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Family favorite Easy and so good! We couldn’t stop eating it! Added extra mozzarella, only 2 packets of Italian dressing mix and used red and yellow peppers and added extra Italian dressing! Definitely a keeper! 03 of 46 Photo by  Michael DeLuca 07/24/2021 04 of 46 Photo by  Seanathon 07/17/2021 05 of 46 Photo by  Michelle Seace Traino 05/20/2021 Okay, before I review this, I have to add that my boyfriend made a recipe up in his head at work, and it turned out to be remarkably close to this one. I was at home looking on here for a recipe that would fit our tastes and found this one. While he was preparing the ingredients, I happen to notice that they were very similar to the ingredients in this recipe. Only a couple of things were different. He added pepperoni and cucumbers instead of the black olives and parmesan cheese and used a 16oz bottle of dressing and 1pkg of the dry instead of what this one called for. It was delicious. We loved it! We plan to follow this recipe next time so we can compare. I was just amazed at how much alike this recipe and his recipe were. Thanks so much to "both" creators. Soooo tasty! 06 of 46 Photo by  Heather C 10/05/2020 First time making this type of salad. It was so good. I used red bell pepers instead of green ones. I didnt use olives or dry itailian mix. I only used about 1/2 cup dressing or less to my liking. Red onions gives it a bold spice but I love red onion so amount was great. Awesome recipe my family loved it. I will make again or for potluck for Thanksgiving.
